title: Military cabinet
text:
A military cabinet is any <a href="Cabinet%20%28government%29">cabinet</a> composed of members of the <a href="military">military</a>. It may be an advisory body (staff) to a <a href="sovereign">sovereign</a>, head of government or other functionary, such as a minister of war, or it may be the executive cabinet of a <a href="Military%20dictatorship">military government</a>.
In <a href="France">France</a>, both the <a href="prime%20minister">prime minister</a> and the minister of defence have their own military cabinets ("cabinets militaires").
Historically, the rulers of France's colonies, such as the <a href="Resident-General%20in%20Morocco">Resident-General in Morocco</a> and the <a href="Governor-General%20of%20Indochina">Governor-General of Indochina</a>, had their own military cabinets.
